Source code for soil_storage

# -*- coding: utf-8 -*-
"""Soil Storage."""

import numpy as np
from core.verticalwaterbalance import parameters as pm



[docs]class SoilStorage:
    """Compute snow storage and related fluxes.

    Parameters
    ----------
    max_soil_water_content : array
        Maximum soil water content, Units: mm
    builtup_area : array
        Urban or Builtup area fraction, Units: (-)
    drainage_direction : array
        Drainage direction taken based on [1]_, Units: (-)
    max_groundwater_recharge : array
        Maximum groundwater recharge, Units: mm/day
    soil_texture : array
        Soil texture class based on  [1]_, Units: (-)
    groundwater_recharge_factor : array
        Groundwater recharge factor taken from [1]_, Units: (-)
    arid_gw_cell : array
        Humid-arid calssification(array) based on [1]_.

        References.

        .. [1] Müller Schmied, H., Cáceres, D., Eisner, S., Flörke, M.,
                    Herbert, C., Niemann, C., Peiris, T. A., Popat, E.,
                    Portmann, F. T., Reinecke, R., Schumacher, M., Shadkam, S.,
                    Telteu, C.E., Trautmann, T., & Döll, P. (2021).
                    The global water resources and use model WaterGAP v2.2d:
                    model description and evaluation. Geoscientific Model
                    Development, 14(2), 1037–1079.
                    https://doi.org/10.5194/gmd-14-1037-2021


    Methods
    -------
    immediate_runoff:
        Compute immediate runoff.

    daily_soil_storage:
        Compute daily soil storage.
    """

    def __init__(self, static_data):
        soil_static_data = static_data.soil_static_data()

        # ======================================
        #      calulating max_soil_content
        # ======================================
        total_avail_water_content = soil_static_data[1]
        parameters = static_data.canopy_model_parameters
        land_cover = static_data.land_cover
        rooting_depth = np.zeros(land_cover.shape) * np.nan
        for i in range(len(parameters)):
            rooting_depth[land_cover[:, :] == parameters.loc[i, 'Number']] = \
                parameters.loc[i, 'rooting_depth']
        self.max_soil_water_content = \
            np.where(total_avail_water_content > 0,
                     total_avail_water_content * rooting_depth, np.nan)

        self.builtup_area = soil_static_data[0]
        self.drainage_direction = soil_static_data[2]
        self.max_groundwater_recharge = soil_static_data[3]
        self.soil_texture = soil_static_data[4]
        self.groundwater_recharge_factor = soil_static_data[5]
        self.arid_gw_cell = static_data.humid_arid


[docs]    def immediate_runoff(self, effective_precipitation):
        """
        Compute immediate runoff and effective precipitation.

        Parameters
        ----------
        effective_precipitation : array
            Effective precipitation based on [1]_, Units: mm/day

        Returns
        -------
        effective_precipitation : aaray
            Effective precipitation based on [1]_, Units: mm/day
        immediate_runoff : array
            Immediate runoff, Units: mm/day

        References.

        .. [1] Müller Schmied, H., Cáceres, D., Eisner, S., Flörke, M.,
                    Herbert, C., Niemann, C., Peiris, T. A., Popat, E.,
                    Portmann, F. T., Reinecke, R., Schumacher, M., Shadkam, S.,
                    Telteu, C.E., Trautmann, T., & Döll, P. (2021).
                    The global water resources and use model WaterGAP v2.2d:
                    model description and evaluation. Geoscientific Model
                    Development, 14(2), 1037–1079.
                    https://doi.org/10.5194/gmd-14-1037-2021

        """
        runoff_frac_builtup = 0.5
        immediate_runoff = \
            np.where(self.builtup_area > 0,
                     (runoff_frac_builtup * effective_precipitation
                      * self.builtup_area), 0)

        effective_precipitation =\
            np.where(self.builtup_area > 0., effective_precipitation -
                     immediate_runoff, effective_precipitation)
        return effective_precipitation, immediate_runoff



[docs]    def daily_soil_storage(self, soil_water_content, pet_to_soil,
                           land_area_frac, max_temp_elev, canopy_evap,
                           effective_precipitation, precipitation,
                           immediate_runoff, land_storage_change_sum,
                           sublimation):
        """
        Compute daily soil storage.

        Parameters
        ----------
        soil_water_content : array
            Snow water storage, Units: mm
        pet_to_soil : array
            Remaining energy for addtional evaporation from soil, Units: mm
        land_area_frac : array
            Land area fraction, Units: %.
        max_temp_elev : array
            Maximum temperature from the 1st(lowest) elevation, Units: K
        canopy_evap : array
            anopy evaporation,  Units: mm
        effective_precipitation : array
            Effective precipitation based on [1]_, Units: mm/day
        precipitation : array
            Daily precipitation,  Units: mm/day
        immediate_runoff : array
            Immediate runoff, Units: mm/day
        land_storage_change_sum : array
            Sum of change in vertical balance storages, Units: mm
        sublimation : array
            Sublimation, Units: mm

        Returns
        -------
        soil_water_content : array
            Snow water storage, Units: mm
        groundwater_recharge_from_soil_mm : array
            Groundwater recharge from soil, Units: mm/day
        actual_soil_evap : array
            Actual evapotranspiration from the soil, Units: mm/day
        soil_saturation : array
            Soil saturation, Units: (-)
        surface_runoff : array
            Surface runoff from land, Units: mm/day

        """
        # Defining constants
        snow_freeze_temp = 273.15  # K

        # =====================================================================
        # calculating soil water overflow and soil water content
        # =====================================================================
        soil_water_content *= land_area_frac
        # Initial storage to calulate change in soil storage. required for
        # calulating sum of change in vertical balance storages
        initial_storage = soil_water_content

        soil_water_overflow = \
            np.where(soil_water_content > self.max_soil_water_content,
                     soil_water_content - self.max_soil_water_content, 0)

        soil_water_content = \
            np.where(soil_water_content > self.max_soil_water_content,
                     self.max_soil_water_content, soil_water_content)

        # =====================================================================
        # calculating runoff, actual soil evapotranspiration and updating
        # soil water content
        # =====================================================================
        soil_saturation = (soil_water_content/self.max_soil_water_content)

        runoff = effective_precipitation * (soil_saturation)**pm.gamma

        actual_soil_evap = np.minimum(pet_to_soil,
                                      (pm.max_daily_pet - canopy_evap) *
                                      soil_saturation)

        # soil water content is a helper new  variable
        soil_water_content_new = soil_water_content + effective_precipitation \
            - actual_soil_evap - runoff

        #  Note !!!  when too much water has been taken out of the
        #  soil water storage (negative soil storage), soil water content is
        #  set to zero. Daily actual soil evaporation is now corrected by
        #  reducing by the soil water content (negative soil water content)

        actual_soil_evap = np.where(soil_water_content_new < 0,
                                    actual_soil_evap + soil_water_content_new,
                                    actual_soil_evap)

        soil_water_content_new[soil_water_content_new < 0] = 0

        # Note!!!: The above calulated 'actual_soil_evap' and 'soil saturaion'
        # are only true when the maximum temperature of a subgriid cell is
        # greater than snow_freeze temperature.

        actual_soil_evap = \
            np.where((max_temp_elev > snow_freeze_temp) &
                     (self.max_soil_water_content > 0),
                     actual_soil_evap, 0)

        soil_saturation =\
            np.where((max_temp_elev > snow_freeze_temp) &
                     (self.max_soil_water_content > 0),
                     soil_saturation, 0)

        # correcting runoff and immediate runoff with cell corrrection factor
        runoff *= pm.cell_corr_factor
        immediate_runoff *= pm.cell_corr_factor

        # =====================================================================
        # calculating ground water recharge from soil and potential recharge
        # and updating soil water content
        # =====================================================================
        groundwater_recharge_from_soil_mm = \
            np.minimum(self.max_groundwater_recharge,
                       self.groundwater_recharge_factor * runoff)

        potential_gw_recharge = \
            np.where(precipitation <= pm.critcal_gw_precipitation,
                     groundwater_recharge_from_soil_mm, 0)

        # groundwater_recharge_from_soil_mm_new is a helper variable
        groundwater_recharge_from_soil_mm_new = \
            np.where(precipitation <= pm.critcal_gw_precipitation, 0,
                     groundwater_recharge_from_soil_mm)

        # Note!!! If a grid cell is defined as (semi)arid and has coarse
        # (sandy) soil (texture class < 21.), groundwater recharge will only
        # occur if precipitation exceeds a critical value of 12.5 mmd−1,
        # otherwise the water remains in the soil.

        groundwater_recharge_from_soil_mm = \
            np.where(((self.arid_gw_cell == 1) & (self.soil_texture < 21)) &
                     (self.drainage_direction >= 0),
                     groundwater_recharge_from_soil_mm_new,
                     groundwater_recharge_from_soil_mm)

        potential_gw_recharge = \
            np.where(((self.arid_gw_cell == 1) & (self.soil_texture < 21)) &
                     (self.drainage_direction >= 0), potential_gw_recharge, 0)

        # groundwater_recharge_from_soil_mm is only true
        # when the maximum temperature of a subgriid cell is greater than snow
        # freeze temperature.
        groundwater_recharge_from_soil_mm = \
            np.where((max_temp_elev > snow_freeze_temp) &
                     (self.max_soil_water_content > 0),
                     groundwater_recharge_from_soil_mm, 0)

        # updating runoff and soil water content
        runoff -= potential_gw_recharge
        soil_water_content_new += (potential_gw_recharge/pm.cell_corr_factor)

        # ===================================================================
        # Increasing soil water overflow, calulating Total daily run off and
        # updating soil water content
        # ===================================================================
        # soil_water_overflow_new is a helper variable
        soil_water_overflow_new = \
            np.where(soil_water_content_new > self.max_soil_water_content,
                     (soil_water_overflow + soil_water_content_new -
                      self.max_soil_water_content) * pm.cell_corr_factor,
                     soil_water_overflow)

        # if  soil_water_content exceeds maximum soil storage, limit it to the
        # maximum soil storage and let water drain as runoff
        soil_water_content_new =\
            np.where(soil_water_content_new > self.max_soil_water_content,
                     self.max_soil_water_content, soil_water_content_new)

        total_daily_runoff = \
            np.where(self.max_soil_water_content > 0,
                     runoff + immediate_runoff + soil_water_overflow_new, 0)

        # Note!!!: 'effective_precipitation', and the above calulated
        # 'soil_water_overflow', and 'total_daily_runoff ' are only true
        # when the maximum temperature of a subgriid cell is greater than snow
        # freeze temperature.

        effective_precipitation = \
            np.where((max_temp_elev > snow_freeze_temp) &
                     (self.max_soil_water_content > 0),
                     0, effective_precipitation) * pm.cell_corr_factor

        soil_water_overflow =\
            np.where((max_temp_elev > snow_freeze_temp),
                     soil_water_overflow_new,
                     soil_water_overflow * pm.cell_corr_factor)

        total_daily_runoff = \
            np.where((max_temp_elev > snow_freeze_temp),
                     total_daily_runoff,
                     soil_water_overflow + effective_precipitation)

        # updating soil water content
        # Here soil water content_new is  is only true
        # when the maximum temperature of a subgriid cell is greater than snow
        # freeze temperature else we maintained the soil storage from previous
        # time step
        soil_water_content = \
            np.where((max_temp_elev > snow_freeze_temp) &
                     (self.max_soil_water_content > 0),
                     soil_water_content_new, soil_water_content)

        # =====================================================================
        # Calulating (corr_land_aet) corrected actual total evaporation
        # (canopy, snow and soil)
        # Note!!! corr_land_aet is consistent with cell-corrected runoff
        # =====================================================================

        # Sum of change in vertical balance storages
        land_storage_change_sum += soil_water_content - initial_storage

        corr_land_aet =\
            land_storage_change_sum * (pm.cell_corr_factor - 1.0) - \
            precipitation * (pm.cell_corr_factor - 1.0) + \
            (actual_soil_evap + canopy_evap + sublimation) * \
            pm.cell_corr_factor

        # Avoiding negative values for corrected actual total evaporation
        neg_land_aet = np.where(corr_land_aet < 0, corr_land_aet, 0)
        corr_land_aet = np.where(corr_land_aet < 0, 0, corr_land_aet)

        # =====================================================================
        # Adapt soil water content to land area fraction
        # =====================================================================
        soil_water_content = np.where(land_area_frac <= 0, 0,
                                      soil_water_content)

        # =====================================================================
        #                       Surface Runoff
        # =====================================================================
        # Correcting  total_daily_runoff with neg_land_aet
        total_daily_runoff = np.where(neg_land_aet < 0,
                                      total_daily_runoff + neg_land_aet,
                                      total_daily_runoff)
        total_daily_runoff[total_daily_runoff < 0] = 0

        # computing deficit surface runoff from total_daily_runoff and
        # groundwater recharge from soil
        neg_runoff = \
            np.where((total_daily_runoff - groundwater_recharge_from_soil_mm)
                     < 0, (total_daily_runoff -
                           groundwater_recharge_from_soil_mm), 0)

        # The idea here is to reduce soil water content  with deficit surface
        # runoff when groundwater recharge  from soil is larger than total
        # daily runoff
        soil_water_content = \
            np.where((total_daily_runoff - groundwater_recharge_from_soil_mm)
                     < 0, soil_water_content + neg_runoff, soil_water_content)

        # Ensure that groundwater recharge  from soil is not greater than
        # total daily runoff
        groundwater_recharge_from_soil_mm = \
            np.where((total_daily_runoff - groundwater_recharge_from_soil_mm)
                     < 0, total_daily_runoff,
                     groundwater_recharge_from_soil_mm)

        # Finally surface runoff is calculated as follows:
        surface_runoff = total_daily_runoff - groundwater_recharge_from_soil_mm

        return soil_water_content, groundwater_recharge_from_soil_mm, \
            actual_soil_evap, soil_saturation, surface_runoff
